pullRequest.body:
Given a class of morphisms `W : MorphismProperty C`, and two objects `X` and `Y`, we introduce a type-class `HasSmallLocalizedHom.{w} W X Y` which expresses that in the localized category with respect to `W`, the type of morphisms from `X` to `Y` is `w`-small for a certain universe `w`. Under this assumption, we define `SmallHom.{w} W X Y : Type w` as the shrunk type. For any localization functor `L : C ⥤ D` for `W`, we provide a bijection `SmallHom.equiv.{w} W L : SmallHom.{w} W X Y ≃ (L.obj X ⟶ L.obj Y)` that is compatible with the composition of morphisms.

This shall be used in the refactor of `Ext`-groups in abelian categories.

---

- [x] depends on: #13956

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Should `HasSmallLocalizedHom.small` be an instance?

Edit: Or maybe `small_of_hasSmallLocalizedHom`.
Thanks. The one for `W.Q` can be an instance, and indeed, it is better doing so in order to avoid a `letI` below.
I don't think this belongs here?
Indeed, I made generalized this construction `Localization.homEquiv` in #13956.

```suggestion
    (mkInv f hf).comp (mk W f) = mk W (𝟙 X) :=
```

I'm thinking maybe this should be defined for all `Small (X ⟶ Y)`? And then maybe a thin wrapper (abbrev?) over that to preserve the typeclass inference capabilities we currently have. Not sure how easy the second part is though.

No, there must we a specific API for localization, because the morphisms here are computed in a different category from `C` (it happens in the localized category of `W`), and the point of all this API is that we can relate these types `SmallHom` (which depends only on `X`, `Y` and the class `W`) by using any functor `L : C ⥤ D` which satisfies the "universal property" of the localization.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: small types of morphisms in the localized category
